definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: The journal of newly-upgraded universities is a new force in Chinese academic publishing course.
sentences.chinese: 新升格本科院校學報是我國學術出版事業的新生力量。

sentences.english: The actor purple Wan is in 2 years when it was upgraded to the elite of the people.
sentences.chinese: 而男主角紫宛則是在2歲的時候便給人升格爲精英了。

sentences.english: In 1893, under a state law, Mount Holyoke Female Seminary became a college.
sentences.chinese: 1893年，州立法將曼荷蓮女子學院升格爲大學。

sentences.english: In this process, the dragon upgraded to King, dragon temples were built throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 在此過程中，龍升格爲王，龍王廟遍佈全國各地。

definition: to promote to a higher position
to expand (esp. by new recruitment)/to increase the army/to augment
to transfer/to move to another post
to belong to (a category)/to be attached to
